      static int LANE_WIDTH
      declares the width of the lanes used, should not be edited if you don't know what you do

      void deleteObject​(StreetObject obj)  
      java.util.HashSet<StreetObject> findCollisions​(StreetObject obj)
      Detects if there is an collision with an existing object on the current position x and y movements are therefore set to 0
      java.util.HashSet<StreetObject> findCollisions​(StreetObject obj, int xMovement, int yMovement)
      Detects if there is an collision with an existing object on the current position and on the way the x and y movements describe Objects with a negative hardness level are unable to collide

      • findCollisions

        java.util.HashSet<StreetObject> findCollisions​(StreetObject obj,
                                               int xMovement,
                                               int yMovement)
        Detects if there is an collision with an existing object on the current position and on the way the x and y movements describe Objects with a negative hardness level are unable to collide
        Parameters:
        obj - object to check for collisions
        xMovement - xMovement of the object
        yMovement - yMovement of the object
        Returns:
        collisions set of other object with collision

      • findCollisions

        java.util.HashSet<StreetObject> findCollisions​(StreetObject obj)
        Detects if there is an collision with an existing object on the current position x and y movements are therefore set to 0
        Parameters:
        obj - object to check for collisions
        Returns:
        collisions set of other objects with collision

      • moduloCircleX

        int moduloCircleX​(int old)
        Will always return a positive value to enable circling through the canvas
        Parameters:
        old - old x or y position to perform modulo on
        Returns:
        new new x or y position after performing modulo

        Lane getFirstLane()
